III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Description prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/27/25, staff conducted an unapproved restraint.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed via phone on September 29,
2025 and face to face at the facility on September 30, 2025.
Administrator reported he had reviewed the restraint that occurred
on September 27, 2025, via video. He reported there was a
concern with Staff 1 not completing the restraint correctly, as is
taught in the CPI protocol. Administrator reported he saw for a few
seconds that Staff 1 had his hands near Youth A’s neck, and it
appeared to be a choke hold. He reported Staff 2 had stepped in
within a few seconds and told Staff 1 that it was incorrect
positioning. Administrator reported Staff 1 stepped out of the
situation and took full responsibility for completing the hold
incorrectly. He reported that from talking to staff on shift, it
appeared Staff 1 had no ill intent and just had the wrong
positioning. Administrator reported whenever there is a restraint at
the facility, the supervisor on shift will review the video with the
staff, and then he will review the video with the supervisor. He
reported the facility is well invested in reviewing all their restraints
and where they can learn to perform better.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 30, 2025. Youth A reported he feels safe at the facility
and identifies Staff 1 as his most supportive staff member.
Consultant noticed Youth A’s hand was bandaged up and asked
Youth A what occurred. He reported the other day, September 27,
2025, he became upset for a dumb reason and punched the
bookshelf numerous times. Youth A reported he received medical
attention right away. Consultant asked Youth A to explain more
about what happened that day. He reported he became upset with
Youth B over a deck of cards and wanted to fight Youth B. Youth
A reported Staff 1 encouraged Youth A to make better choices
2

and not to fight Youth B. He reported Staff 1 encouraged him to go
outside to take a walk to help calm him down, and Youth A
reported he refused to do that. Youth A reported staff attempted to
restrain him because when he was trying to get to Youth B’s
bedroom, staff were blocking him, and he was assaulting the staff.
He reported he does not remember much, but remembers he tried
to choke Staff 1 and pushed Staff 2. When asked about the
attempted restraint hold, Youth A explained the staff on shift did
everything appropriate, and he had no concerns about their
actions. He denied getting harmed by any of the staff. Youth A
reported staff tried to redirect him, but he did not listen and next
time he needs to learn to just walk away.
Youth B was not interviewed as he was not a witness to the
restraint and was only involved as he was the target that
Youth A wanted to fight.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 30, 2025. Youth C reported he likes living at the
facility and feels safe here. He reported he sat in the milieu area
when Youth A was getting restrained on September 27, 2025.
Youth C reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to verbally de-escalate
Youth A to calm him down as he was upset with Youth B. He
reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 ended up restraining Youth A because
Youth A had pushed Staff 2 and was becoming physically
aggressive. Youth C reported staff only restrain a youth when they
are being physically assaultive towards others or trying to harm
themselves. He reported he saw no concerns with the restraint
and stated the staff members involved acted appropriately. Youth
C reported he had no concerns that he wanted to report.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 30, 2025. Staff 1 reported he has a good relationship
with the youth, including Youth A. He reported Youth A was upset
on September 27, 2025, with Youth B over some playing cards.
Staff 1 reported he encouraged both youth to take space from one
another, and Youth B went to his room. He reported he
encouraged Youth A to go outside with him to let off some steam,
but Youth A refused. Staff 1 reported Youth A continued to pace
around the milieu area and attempted to get into Youth B’s room.
He reported at one point, Youth B was encouraged to leave his
room for safety reasons, but he refused to leave. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Supervisor were all on the unit trying to help
Youth A calm down and provide him with some space. He
reported at one point, Youth A attempted to get into Youth B’s
room, and Staff 2 and Staff 3 stood in the space blocking Youth A.
3

Staff 1 reported this upset Youth A, which resulted in him
becoming physical towards Staff 2. He reported that through this
whole situation, there were a couple of occasions he went into a
restraint with Youth A due to assaultive behaviors. Staff 1 reported
he could not remember the specific order of what occurred. He
reported he remembered that in one restraint, Youth A had
dropped his body weight, and before Staff 1 could release him,
Youth A had brought Staff 1 to the ground with him. Staff 1
reported while on the ground, Youth A tried to kick and grab Staff
1’s neck. He reported within another restraint; Youth A had
assaulted Staff 2 and was able to break his arm free from the
restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A then put Staff 1 into a headlock
with his released arm, which was causing Staff 1 issues with his
breathing. He reported Staff 2 was able to get Youth A’s arm
removed, and while Staff 1 was repositioning his hold on Youth A
that Staff 1 put his own arm around Youth A’s head. Staff 1
reported he knew that was not appropriate, and Staff 2 also called
this out. He reported within a minute, he released and stepped out
of the hold. Staff 1 reported he had no ill intentions within the
situation and takes responsibility for doing this. He reported Youth
A has a known history of attempting to choke people as his form
of physical aggression. Staff 1 reported he attempted all his
techniques to try to calm Youth A down, but Youth A was in his
tunnel vision. He reported Youth A was able to process with him
over the situation, and Youth A broke down in tears about this
situation. Staff 1 reported he suffers from asthma, so when Youth
A had him in that choke hold, he was also struggling to breathe,
and when he stepped out of the hold, he had an asthma attack.
He reported he used to be a corrections officer and came to the
facility to try to help these youth not end up in that type of system.
Staff 1 reported the facility does a great job with communicating
what is going on with the youth’s treatment plan, their history, their
triggers, and ways to de-escalate the youth. He reported even
after any restraints that occur, the team involved will review the
video footage with the supervisor to see where they can learn to
do things better and see what went well in the situation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 30, 2025. Staff 2 reported on September 27, 2025,
Youth A was trying to fight Youth B over some type of playing
cards. She reported when Youth A and Youth B got into a verbal
argument, Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to separate the youth by giving
them the choice to walk around outside or go to the gym. Staff 2
reported Youth B chose to go into his room to spend some time,
and Youth A stayed in the milieu area. She reported Youth A
continued to pace around the milieu and appeared to be frustrated
4

with Youth B as he was continuing to swear at Youth B. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 tried to intervene and encouraged Youth A to go
take a walk outside, but he continued to refuse. Staff 2 reported
the staff allowed Youth A to have some space and continue to
walk around the milieu. After about ten minutes, Supervisor
entered the building with some other youth. She reported
Supervisor tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A, which did not
work. Staff 2 reported Youth A then went towards Youth B’s
bedroom. She reported herself and Staff 3 positioned themselves
at the doorway using proxemics to prevent Youth A from entering
the room. This escalated Youth A further, and he attempted to
push past staff while making physical threats. Staff 2 reported she
initiated a restraint with Staff 1. She reported they attempted to do
a standing hold, but Youth A was able to get out of the hold. Staff
2 reported Youth A then hit her when he was released. She
reported Staff 1 then re-engaged with Youth A in a one-person
standing hold, but Youth A dropped his weight to the floor, which
brought Staff 1 to the floor with him. Staff 2 reported she was the
support staff within this situation and helped them both get up.
She reported Youth A was still attempting to get into Youth B’s
bedroom. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 did try to encourage Youth B to
move out of his room, but he refused. She reported Youth B’s
roommate, Youth C, did leave the room and sat in the milieu area.
Staff 2 reported Youth A then punched the bookshelf a couple of
times. She reported due to the attempts to get into Youth B’s
bedroom, Youth A was then restrained again by herself and Staff
1. Staff 2 reported they went into a standing hold, but Youth A was
able to get his one arm free. She reported at one point, Youth A
did attempt to grab her neck. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 was able to
help support in getting Youth A’s arm back into the right spot to be
held by Staff 2. She reported Youth A got his other arm free and
put his arm around Staff 1’s neck and put him into a headlock.
Staff 2 reported she was able to move Youth A’s arm off of Staff
1’s neck. She reported Staff 1 attempted to reposition his hold and
ended up putting Youth A into a headlock with his own arm. Staff
2 reported within a minute, she redirected Staff 1 to move his arm,
and Staff 1 ended up tapping out of the situation. She reported
they were disengaged from the situation, and Youth A was able to
eventually calm down and process with Staff 1 per his request.
Staff 2 reported they attempted to do everything they could to
prevent the restraint from occurring. She reported Staff 1 followed
her redirect immediately, as he was doing the hold improperly.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor and Staff 3 did provide assistance with
the situation and helped monitor the other youth who were in the
unit.
5

Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 30, 2025. Supervisor reported on September 27,
2025, she was returning from the dining hall with a couple of other
youth and could see that Youth A was getting escalated. She
reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were all present on the milieu
area, trying to work with Youth A. Supervisor reported Staff 1 was
giving Youth A the option to go outside to go for a walk to calm
down, but Youth A refused that suggestion. She reported Youth A
was very upset with Youth B and was attempting to physically fight
him. Supervisor reported Youth A kept yelling and swearing at the
staff in the milieu. She reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 blocked Youth
A from going into Youth B’s bedroom. Supervisor reported when
Youth A pushed Staff 2 multiple times, that is when Staff 1 and
Staff 2 tried to complete a two-person standing restraint with
Youth A. Supervisor reported during that time, she continued to
watch the situation but also complete check-ins on the other youth
that had gone to their rooms. She reported Youth C came out into
the milieu during this time. Supervisor reported Staff 3 was
monitoring the restraint as well. She reported at one point; Youth
A was able to drop his body weight and bring Staff 1 to the floor.
Supervisor reported at this point, she went over to assist in the
situation and saw that Youth A was trying to do a choke hold
around Staff 1’s neck. She reported Staff 1 was able to get away,
and Youth A got off the floor. Staff continued to try to verbally de-
escalate the situation and give Youth A space. Supervisor
reported Youth A then punched the bookshelf multiple times. She
reported after he punched the bookshelf, he tried to get into Youth
B’s room again, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 blocked him from going into
the room. Supervisor reported during that time, she continued to
watch and coach the situation, which Staff 3 did check ins with the
other youth. She reported Youth A then tried to hit Staff 2, which
resulted in Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempting to get Youth A into a
standing restraint. Supervisor reported Staff 3 also joined to assist
the other staff. She reported within that hold, Youth A was able to
get his arm free and put his arm around Staff 1’s neck and put him
in a headlock. Supervisor reported Staff 2 was able to get Youth
A’s arm off of Staff 1’s neck. She reported at one point, Staff 1 did
put his arm around Youth A’s neck, but Staff 2 redirected him, and
in less than two minutes, Staff 1 released and stepped away from
the situation. Supervisor reported Youth A was released and
continued to walk around. She reported Youth A finally de-
escalated from the situation and started to cry due to feeling
remorse for the situation. Supervisor reported Youth A processed
with Staff 1 as Youth A requested to talk with him. She reported
Staff 1 did a great job of stepping out of the situation as soon as
he was in an inappropriate hold. Supervisor reported after the
6

situation, she was able to get Youth A medical attention for
punching the bookcase. She reported she had also reviewed the
video footage with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 to process the
situation. Supervisor reported she also reviewed the video footage
and processed the situation right away with Administrator.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on October 7, 2025. Staff 3
reported that on September 27, 2025, Youth A was upset with
Youth B. She reported Staff 1 was attempting to redirect Youth A
away from Youth B’s room because Youth A was threatening to
fight Youth B. Staff 3 reported Youth A continued to ignore the
redirects and became more physically violent towards staff. She
reported she walked away to check in on the other youth on the
unit. Staff 3 reported when she walked back into the main area,
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were going into a restraint with Youth A. She
reported she stepped in at one moment to help Staff 2 get Youth A
into the proper hold. Staff 3 reported she witnessed Youth A put
his arm around Staff 1’s neck in what appeared to be a choke hold
position. She reported Staff 2 assisted with getting Youth A’s arm
off of Staff 1’s neck. Staff 3 reported after this situation occurred;
she witnessed Staff 1 put his arm around Youth A’s neck. She
reported Staff 2 redirected Staff 1 immediately that this was an
incorrect hold and Staff 1 disengaged and stepped away
immediately from the situation. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
followed all the protocol they are trained on to help avoid a
restraint. She reported the only issue with this restraint was Staff 1
placing his arm around Youth A’s neck, but he was completely
disengaged when prompted. Staff 3 reported she has never seen
any concerns with Staff 1 and Staff 2’s interactions with the youth
at the facility.
Video Recording:
Video recording of September 27, 2025, of the main milieu area
was reviewed by this consultant with Administrator during the
onsite visit at the facility on September 30, 2025. The video
footage shows Youth A was in the main area continuously walking
around. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen talking to Youth A, but there is
no sound to the video to hear what they are saying. Youth A
continued to try to walk up to the bedroom door area, which
Administrator pointed out was Youth B’s bedroom. The video could
not be zoomed in to see exactly what was happening as the bedroom
area was in the corner of the screen. The video does show Staff 2
and Staff 3 going over to the area with Youth A, while Staff 1 stood
back. Youth C was also sitting in the milieu area and Supervisor was
checking in on the other youth. The video footage is not fully clear as
there was what appeared to be a restraint hold that occurred near the
corner of the video that is also near the bathroom area of the room.
7

Staff 1 is seen engaging in an appropriate one person hold with
Youth A but then Staff 2 stepped in front of the hold and blocked the
video camera. Youth A is seen getting up off the floor and punching
the bookshelf. All the staff are seen giving Youth A space from this
area. Youth A is seen going towards the bedroom area again and
Staff 1 and Staff 2 intervene. They then end up in another restraint
towards the wall area. Again, due to the angle of the video the full
situation could not be seen. Staff 3 does walk up to the hold for
assistance. It is seen in the video Youth A getting his arm free and
placing it over Staff 1’s neck like a choke hold position. Staff 2 is
seen taking Youth A’s arm off of Staff 1’s neck. Staff 1 is seen
repositioning, and his arm is up towards Youth A’s neck. Then it is
seen Staff 1 stepping out from the hold. Youth A is then released and
walks out of the view of the camera.
Documents Reviewed:
- MiSACWIS Restraint Report 220480265- This report is
consistent with the details of the restraints that occurred per
the interviews with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been
employed with the facility since 09/30/2024. He has no
disciplinary actions noted within his HR file. Staff 1 is up to
date on all required training. He completed the facility’s
restraint model training on 10/23/2024 and most recent
refresher training was on 01/25/2025
- Facility’s Behavior Management Philosophy and
Procedures- Within this policy it notes that the facility
follows the Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) model. The
policy notes that any physical behavior management
intervention will be used as a last resort and after
nonphysical techniques are exhausted. To promote safety
a team approach is always best practice. Which per this
incident appears to be followed. The policy also notes that
staff cannot utilize physical management to address
behavioral issues, only if there is an unanticipated or
severe threat of danger to an individual. Within this incident
staff and youth all indicated Youth A was attempting to
physically attack Youth B.
- Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) Model – There are no
holds approved by this model that would allow a staff
member to place their hand/arm near a youth’s neck.
8

Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with the rule as it was found
within interviews and video review that Staff 1 did not perform a
restraint on Youth A in an approved, safe manner. It was found
that Staff 1 did place his arm around Youth A’s neck for a short
period of time, which is not a safe restraint technique. It should be
noted that Staff 2 noticed Staff 1’s hold was inappropriate and
redirected him right away. Staff 1 immediately disengaged the
unsafe hold and stepped away from the situation.
Technical Assistance
When reviewing the facility’s behavior management policy that the
section for prohibited techniques does not address all the points
outlined within state licensing rule R400.4158 (1) (a) (i-v). This
consultant provided technical assistance to the facility to update
their policy to incorporate all prohibited techniques that are noted
in the licensing rule.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
